meanings.definition: More experienced or sophisticated in worldly matters.
meanings.sent1: She became worldlier after traveling to different countries and experiencing diverse cultures.
meanings.sent2: The businessman was considered worldlier than his younger colleagues due to his extensive knowledge of global markets.
meanings.sent3: The cat, with a worldlier attitude than most, observed the chaos of the household with a knowing look.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a worldlier gaze, as if she had seen far more than her years would suggest.
meanings.sent5: The old book exuded a worldlier charm, its pages filled with tales of distant lands and ancient civilizations.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the material world as opposed to the spiritual world.
meanings.sent1: The worldlier concerns of wealth and status often overshadowed the monk's spiritual pursuits.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a worldlier scene, with bustling city streets and towering skyscrapers.
meanings.sent3: The philosopher humorously debated the merits of a worldlier existence versus a purely spiritual one.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a battleground between the worldlier desires of the flesh and the ethereal call of the spirit.
meanings.sent5: The contrast between the worldlier decorations of the room and the serene meditation corner was stark and thought-provoking.
